Package io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.config

Interface ValueMapper<T,​E extends com.google.gson.JsonElement>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type that this mapper can serialise.
    E - The JSON element type this mapper uses.
    public interface ValueMapper<T,​E extends com.google.gson.JsonElement>
    A way to serialise values of a specific type for a config file. See ConfigManager for more info.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Class<E> element()
      Gets the class of the JSON element type this mapper uses.
      T fromJSON​(E json, java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
      Reads an object from JSON.
      default T read​(net.minecraft.network.PacketBuffer buffer, java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
      Reads a value from a PacketBuffer.
      E toJSON​(T value, java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
      Serialises a value to JSON.
      java.lang.Class<T> type()
      Gets the class of the type that this mapper can serialise.

      Writes a value to a PacketBuffer.

    • Method Detail

      • type

        java.lang.Class<T> type()
        Gets the class of the type that this mapper can serialise.

      • element

        java.lang.Class<E> element()
        Gets the class of the JSON element type this mapper uses.

      • fromJSON

        T fromJSON​(E json,
           java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
        Reads an object from JSON. If the json is invalid you may either throw an IllegalStateException or a JsonParseException to end config parsing with an error, or just correct errors yourself and return default values.
        Parameters:
        json - The json data
        elementType - The element type specified in the @Config annotation. If it's left out, this will be void.class
        Returns:
        The value read.

      • toJSON

        E toJSON​(T value,
         java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
        Serialises a value to JSON.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialise
        elementType - The element type specified in the @Config annotation. If it's left out, this will be void.class
        Returns:
        The resulting json data.

      • read

        default T read​(net.minecraft.network.PacketBuffer buffer,
               java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
        Reads a value from a PacketBuffer. The default implementation expects a JSON string and gives this string to fromJSON.

      • write

        default void write​(T value,
                   net.minecraft.network.PacketBuffer buffer,
                   java.lang.Class<?> elementType)
        Writes a value to a PacketBuffer. The default implementation calls toJSON and writes the resulting JSON as a string.
